channel.title: Comments on: BBC Shows on iTunes Music Store

item.title: By: Matt White
item.dc:creator: Matt White
item.description: <p>Been a happy Mac user for years now John, and I can use the Flash iPlayer on my Mac as well as a Windows machine. But I would be willing to pay for the mobility etc of an iTunes, I just think that £1.89 is too much.</p>
item.content:encoded: Been a happy Mac user for years now John, and I can use the Flash iPlayer on my Mac as well as a Windows machine. But I would be willing to pay for the mobility etc of an iTunes, I just think that £1.89 is too much.

item.title: By: John Wylie
item.dc:creator: John Wylie
item.description: <p>Ok, just checked the blog and see you do own a Mac.<br /><br />Time to write a hurry-up note to the BBC then <img alt="Emoticon" src="<a rel="nofollow ugc">http://www.11tmr.com/11tmr.nsf/emoticons/DLYH-5MZVLS/$File/biggrin.gif"</a> /> </p>
item.content:encoded:
Ok, just checked the blog and see you do own a Mac.

Time to write a hurry-up note to the BBC then http://www.11tmr.com/11tmr.nsf/emoticons/DLYH-5MZVLS/$File/biggrin.gif“ />

item.title: By: John Wylie
item.dc:creator: John Wylie
item.description: <p>I rarely watch live TV. I do have a freeview recorder, Humax,which is excellent for recording those programs worth watching.<br /><br />More to the point, can't you get these BBC prog's via iPlayer? Even if it is win32 only it is less than £1.89 and at least they have woken up to firefox - or are you now a happy Mac owner?</p>
item.content:encoded:
I rarely watch live TV. I do have a freeview recorder, Humax,which is excellent for recording those programs worth watching.

More to the point, can’t you get these BBC prog’s via iPlayer? Even if it is win32 only it is less than £1.89 and at least they have woken up to firefox – or are you now a happy Mac owner?
